CWE-1007.name: Insufficient Visual Distinction of Homoglyphs Presented to User
CWE-1007.description: The product displays information or identifiers to a user, but the display mechanism does not make it easy for the user to distinguish between visually similar or identical glyphs (homoglyphs), which may cause the user to misinterpret a glyph and perform an unintended, insecure action.

CWE-1021.name: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames
CWE-1021.description: The web application does not restrict or incorrectly restricts frame objects or UI layers that belong to another application or domain, which can lead to user confusion about which interface the user is interacting with.

CWE-1024.name: Comparison of Incompatible Types
CWE-1024.description: The product performs a comparison between two entities, but the entities are of different, incompatible types that cannot be guaranteed to provide correct results when they are directly compared.

CWE-1025.name: Comparison Using Wrong Factors
CWE-1025.description: The code performs a comparison between two entities, but the comparison examines the wrong factors or characteristics of the entities, which can lead to incorrect results and resultant weaknesses.

CWE-1037.name: Processor Optimization Removal or Modification of Security-critical Code
CWE-1037.description: The developer builds a security-critical protection mechanism into the software, but the processor optimizes the execution of the program such that the mechanism is removed or modified.

CWE-1041.name: Use of Redundant Code
CWE-1041.description: The product has multiple functions, methods, procedures, macros, etc. that contain the same code.

CWE-1043.name: Data Element Aggregating an Excessively Large Number of Non-Primitive Elements
CWE-1043.description: The product uses a data element that has an excessively large number of sub-elements with non-primitive data types such as structures or aggregated objects.

CWE-1044.name: Architecture with Number of Horizontal Layers Outside of Expected Range
CWE-1044.description: The product's architecture contains too many - or too few - horizontal layers.

CWE-1045.name: Parent Class with a Virtual Destructor and a Child Class without a Virtual Destructor
CWE-1045.description: A parent class has a virtual destructor method, but the parent has a child class that does not have a virtual destructor.

CWE-1046.name: Creation of Immutable Text Using String Concatenation
CWE-1046.description: The product creates an immutable text string using string concatenation operations.

CWE-1047.name: Modules with Circular Dependencies
CWE-1047.description: The product contains modules in which one module has references that cycle back to itself, i.e., there are circular dependencies.

CWE-1048.name: Invokable Control Element with Large Number of Outward Calls
CWE-1048.description: The code contains callable control elements that contain an excessively large number of references to other application objects external to the context of the callable, i.e. a Fan-Out value that is excessively large.

CWE-1049.name: Excessive Data Query Operations in a Large Data Table
CWE-1049.description: The product performs a data query with a large number of joins and sub-queries on a large data table.

CWE-1050.name: Excessive Platform Resource Consumption within a Loop
CWE-1050.description: The product has a loop body or loop condition that contains a control element that directly or indirectly consumes platform resources, e.g. messaging, sessions, locks, or file descriptors.

CWE-1051.name: Initialization with Hard-Coded Network Resource Configuration Data
CWE-1051.description: The product initializes data using hard-coded values that act as network resource identifiers.

CWE-1052.name: Excessive Use of Hard-Coded Literals in Initialization
CWE-1052.description: The product initializes a data element using a hard-coded literal that is not a simple integer or static constant element.

CWE-1053.name: Missing Documentation for Design
CWE-1053.description: The product does not have documentation that represents how it is designed.

CWE-1054.name: Invocation of a Control Element at an Unnecessarily Deep Horizontal Layer
CWE-1054.description: The code at one architectural layer invokes code that resides at a deeper layer than the adjacent layer, i.e., the invocation skips at least one layer, and the invoked code is not part of a vertical utility layer that can be referenced from any horizontal layer.

CWE-1055.name: Multiple Inheritance from Concrete Classes
CWE-1055.description: The product contains a class with inheritance from more than one concrete class.

CWE-1056.name: Invokable Control Element with Variadic Parameters
CWE-1056.description: A named-callable or method control element has a signature that supports a variable (variadic) number of parameters or arguments.

CWE-1057.name: Data Access Operations Outside of Expected Data Manager Component
CWE-1057.description: The product uses a dedicated, central data manager component as required by design, but it contains code that performs data-access operations that do not use this data manager.

CWE-1058.name: Invokable Control Element in Multi-Thread Context with non-Final Static Storable or Member Element
CWE-1058.description: The code contains a function or method that operates in a multi-threaded environment but owns an unsafe non-final static storable or member data element.

CWE-1060.name: Excessive Number of Inefficient Server-Side Data Accesses
CWE-1060.description: The product performs too many data queries without using efficient data processing functionality such as stored procedures.

CWE-1062.name: Parent Class with References to Child Class
CWE-1062.description: The code has a parent class that contains references to a child class, its methods, or its members.

CWE-1063.name: Creation of Class Instance within a Static Code Block
CWE-1063.description: A static code block creates an instance of a class.

CWE-1064.name: Invokable Control Element with Signature Containing an Excessive Number of Parameters
CWE-1064.description: The product contains a function, subroutine, or method whose signature has an unnecessarily large number of parameters/arguments.

CWE-1065.name: Runtime Resource Management Control Element in a Component Built to Run on Application Servers
CWE-1065.description: The product uses deployed components from application servers, but it also uses low-level functions/methods for management of resources, instead of the API provided by the application server.

CWE-1066.name: Missing Serialization Control Element
CWE-1066.description: The product contains a serializable data element that does not have an associated serialization method.

CWE-1067.name: Excessive Execution of Sequential Searches of Data Resource
CWE-1067.description: The product contains a data query against an SQL table or view that is configured in a way that does not utilize an index and may cause sequential searches to be performed.

CWE-1068.name: Inconsistency Between Implementation and Documented Design
CWE-1068.description: The implementation of the product is not consistent with the design as described within the relevant documentation.

CWE-1070.name: Serializable Data Element Containing non-Serializable Item Elements
CWE-1070.description: The product contains a serializable, storable data element such as a field or member, but the data element contains member elements that are not serializable.

CWE-1071.name: Empty Code Block
CWE-1071.description: The source code contains a block that does not contain any code, i.e., the block is empty.

CWE-1072.name: Data Resource Access without Use of Connection Pooling
CWE-1072.description: The product accesses a data resource through a database without using a connection pooling capability.

CWE-1073.name: Non-SQL Invokable Control Element with Excessive Number of Data Resource Accesses
CWE-1073.description: The product contains a client with a function or method that contains a large number of data accesses/queries that are sent through a data manager, i.e., does not use efficient database capabilities.

CWE-1074.name: Class with Excessively Deep Inheritance
CWE-1074.description: A class has an inheritance level that is too high, i.e., it has a large number of parent classes.

CWE-1075.name: Unconditional Control Flow Transfer outside of Switch Block
CWE-1075.description: The product performs unconditional control transfer (such as a "goto") in code outside of a branching structure such as a switch block.

CWE-1079.name: Parent Class without Virtual Destructor Method
CWE-1079.description: A parent class contains one or more child classes, but the parent class does not have a virtual destructor method.

CWE-1080.name: Source Code File with Excessive Number of Lines of Code
CWE-1080.description: A source code file has too many lines of code.

CWE-1082.name: Class Instance Self Destruction Control Element
CWE-1082.description: The code contains a class instance that calls the method or function to delete or destroy itself.

CWE-1083.name: Data Access from Outside Expected Data Manager Component
CWE-1083.description: The product is intended to manage data access through a particular data manager component such as a relational or non-SQL database, but it contains code that performs data access operations without using that component.

CWE-1084.name: Invokable Control Element with Excessive File or Data Access Operations
CWE-1084.description: A function or method contains too many operations that utilize a data manager or file resource.

CWE-1085.name: Invokable Control Element with Excessive Volume of Commented-out Code
CWE-1085.description: A function, method, procedure, etc. contains an excessive amount of code that has been commented out within its body.

CWE-1086.name: Class with Excessive Number of Child Classes
CWE-1086.description: A class contains an unnecessarily large number of children.

CWE-1087.name: Class with Virtual Method without a Virtual Destructor
CWE-1087.description: A class contains a virtual method, but the method does not have an associated virtual destructor.

CWE-1089.name: Large Data Table with Excessive Number of Indices
CWE-1089.description: The product uses a large data table that contains an excessively large number of indices.

CWE-1090.name: Method Containing Access of a Member Element from Another Class
CWE-1090.description: A method for a class performs an operation that directly accesses a member element from another class.

CWE-1092.name: Use of Same Invokable Control Element in Multiple Architectural Layers
CWE-1092.description: The product uses the same control element across multiple architectural layers.

CWE-1094.name: Excessive Index Range Scan for a Data Resource
CWE-1094.description: The product contains an index range scan for a large data table, but the scan can cover a large number of rows.

CWE-1095.name: Loop Condition Value Update within the Loop
CWE-1095.description: The product uses a loop with a control flow condition based on a value that is updated within the body of the loop.

CWE-1097.name: Persistent Storable Data Element without Associated Comparison Control Element
CWE-1097.description: The product uses a storable data element that does not have all of the associated functions or methods that are necessary to support comparison.

CWE-1098.name: Data Element containing Pointer Item without Proper Copy Control Element
CWE-1098.description: The code contains a data element with a pointer that does not have an associated copy or constructor method.

CWE-1099.name: Inconsistent Naming Conventions for Identifiers
CWE-1099.description: The product's code, documentation, or other artifacts do not consistently use the same naming conventions for variables, callables, groups of related callables, I/O capabilities, data types, file names, or similar types of elements.

CWE-1100.name: Insufficient Isolation of System-Dependent Functions
CWE-1100.description: The product or code does not isolate system-dependent functionality into separate standalone modules.

CWE-1101.name: Reliance on Runtime Component in Generated Code
CWE-1101.description: The product uses automatically-generated code that cannot be executed without a specific runtime support component.

CWE-1102.name: Reliance on Machine-Dependent Data Representation
CWE-1102.description: The code uses a data representation that relies on low-level data representation or constructs that may vary across different processors, physical machines, OSes, or other physical components.

CWE-1103.name: Use of Platform-Dependent Third Party Components
CWE-1103.description: The product relies on third-party components that do not provide equivalent functionality across all desirable platforms.

CWE-1104.name: Use of Unmaintained Third Party Components
CWE-1104.description: The product relies on third-party components that are not actively supported or maintained by the original developer or a trusted proxy for the original developer.

CWE-1105.name: Insufficient Encapsulation of Machine-Dependent Functionality
CWE-1105.description: The product or code uses machine-dependent functionality, but it does not sufficiently encapsulate or isolate this functionality from the rest of the code.

CWE-1106.name: Insufficient Use of Symbolic Constants
CWE-1106.description: The source code uses literal constants that may need to change or evolve over time, instead of using symbolic constants.

CWE-1107.name: Insufficient Isolation of Symbolic Constant Definitions
CWE-1107.description: The source code uses symbolic constants, but it does not sufficiently place the definitions of these constants into a more centralized or isolated location.

CWE-1108.name: Excessive Reliance on Global Variables
CWE-1108.description: The code is structured in a way that relies too much on using or setting global variables throughout various points in the code, instead of preserving the associated information in a narrower, more local context.

CWE-1109.name: Use of Same Variable for Multiple Purposes
CWE-1109.description: The code contains a callable, block, or other code element in which the same variable is used to control more than one unique task or store more than one instance of data.

CWE-1110.name: Incomplete Design Documentation
CWE-1110.description: The product's design documentation does not adequately describe control flow, data flow, system initialization, relationships between tasks, components, rationales, or other important aspects of the design.

CWE-1111.name: Incomplete I/O Documentation
CWE-1111.description: The product's documentation does not adequately define inputs, outputs, or system/software interfaces.

CWE-1112.name: Incomplete Documentation of Program Execution
CWE-1112.description: The document does not fully define all mechanisms that are used to control or influence how product-specific programs are executed.

CWE-1113.name: Inappropriate Comment Style
CWE-1113.description: The source code uses comment styles or formats that are inconsistent or do not follow expected standards for the product.

CWE-1114.name: Inappropriate Whitespace Style
CWE-1114.description: The source code contains whitespace that is inconsistent across the code or does not follow expected standards for the product.

CWE-1115.name: Source Code Element without Standard Prologue
CWE-1115.description: The source code contains elements such as source files that do not consistently provide a prologue or header that has been standardized for the project.

CWE-1116.name: Inaccurate Source Code Comments
CWE-1116.description: The source code contains comments that do not accurately describe or explain aspects of the portion of the code with which the comment is associated.

CWE-1117.name: Callable with Insufficient Behavioral Summary
CWE-1117.description: The code contains a function or method whose signature and/or associated inline documentation does not sufficiently describe the callable's inputs, outputs, side effects, assumptions, or return codes.

CWE-1118.name: Insufficient Documentation of Error Handling Techniques
CWE-1118.description: The documentation does not sufficiently describe the techniques that are used for error handling, exception processing, or similar mechanisms.

CWE-1119.name: Excessive Use of Unconditional Branching
CWE-1119.description: The code uses too many unconditional branches (such as "goto").

CWE-112.name: Missing XML Validation
CWE-112.description: The product accepts XML from an untrusted source but does not validate the XML against the proper schema.

CWE-1121.name: Excessive McCabe Cyclomatic Complexity
CWE-1121.description: The code contains McCabe cyclomatic complexity that exceeds a desirable maximum.

CWE-1122.name: Excessive Halstead Complexity
CWE-1122.description: The code is structured in a way that a Halstead complexity measure exceeds a desirable maximum.

CWE-1123.name: Excessive Use of Self-Modifying Code
CWE-1123.description: The product uses too much self-modifying code.

CWE-1124.name: Excessively Deep Nesting
CWE-1124.description: The code contains a callable or other code grouping in which the nesting / branching is too deep.

CWE-1125.name: Excessive Attack Surface
CWE-1125.description: The product has an attack surface whose quantitative measurement exceeds a desirable maximum.

CWE-1126.name: Declaration of Variable with Unnecessarily Wide Scope
CWE-1126.description: The source code declares a variable in one scope, but the variable is only used within a narrower scope.

CWE-1127.name: Compilation with Insufficient Warnings or Errors
CWE-1127.description: The code is compiled without sufficient warnings enabled, which may prevent the detection of subtle bugs or quality issues.

CWE-115.name: Misinterpretation of Input
CWE-115.description: The product misinterprets an input, whether from an attacker or another product, in a security-relevant fashion.

CWE-117.name: Improper Output Neutralization for Logs
CWE-117.description: The product constructs a log message from external input, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements when the message is written to a log file.

CWE-1173.name: Improper Use of Validation Framework
CWE-1173.description: The product does not use, or incorrectly uses, an input validation framework that is provided by the source language or an independent library.

CWE-1188.name: Initialization of a Resource with an Insecure Default
CWE-1188.description: The product initializes or sets a resource with a default that is intended to be changed by the product's installer, administrator, or maintainer, but the default is not secure.

CWE-120.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')
CWE-120.description: The product copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer.

CWE-1204.name: Generation of Weak Initialization Vector (IV)
CWE-1204.description: The product uses a cryptographic primitive that uses an Initialization Vector (IV), but the product does not generate IVs that are sufficiently unpredictable or unique according to the expected cryptographic requirements for that primitive.

CWE-1220.name: Insufficient Granularity of Access Control
CWE-1220.description: The product implements access controls via a policy or other feature with the intention to disable or restrict accesses (reads and/or writes) to assets in a system from untrusted agents. However, implemented access controls lack required granularity, which renders the control policy too broad because it allows accesses from unauthorized agents to the security-sensitive assets.

CWE-1230.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information Through Metadata
CWE-1230.description: The product prevents direct access to a resource containing sensitive information, but it does not sufficiently limit access to metadata that is derived from the original, sensitive information.

CWE-1235.name: Incorrect Use of Autoboxing and Unboxing for Performance Critical Operations
CWE-1235.description: The code uses boxed primitives, which may introduce inefficiencies into performance-critical operations.

CWE-1236.name: Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
CWE-1236.description: The product saves user-provided information into a Comma-Separated Value (CSV) file, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as a command when the file is opened by a spreadsheet product.

CWE-124.name: Buffer Underwrite ('Buffer Underflow')
CWE-124.description: The product writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location prior to the beginning of the buffer.

CWE-1240.name: Use of a Cryptographic Primitive with a Risky Implementation
CWE-1240.description: To fulfill the need for a cryptographic primitive, the product implements a cryptographic algorithm using a non-standard, unproven, or disallowed/non-compliant cryptographic implementation.

CWE-1241.name: Use of Predictable Algorithm in Random Number Generator
CWE-1241.description: The device uses an algorithm that is predictable and generates a pseudo-random number.

CWE-125.name: Out-of-bounds Read
CWE-125.description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

CWE-1265.name: Unintended Reentrant Invocation of Non-reentrant Code Via Nested Calls
CWE-1265.description: The product invokes code that is believed to be reentrant, but the code performs a call that unintentionally produces a nested invocation of the non-reentrant code.

CWE-128.name: Wrap-around Error
CWE-128.description: Wrap around errors occur whenever a value is incremented past the maximum value for its type and therefore "wraps around" to a very small, negative, or undefined value.

CWE-1284.name: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input
CWE-1284.description: The product receives input that is expected to specify a quantity (such as size or length), but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the quantity has the required properties.

CWE-1285.name: Improper Validation of Specified Index, Position, or Offset in Input
CWE-1285.description: The product receives input that is expected to specify an index, position, or offset into an indexable resource such as a buffer or file, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the specified index/position/offset has the required properties.

CWE-1286.name: Improper Validation of Syntactic Correctness of Input
CWE-1286.description: The product receives input that is expected to be well-formed - i.e., to comply with a certain syntax - but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input complies with the syntax.

CWE-1287.name: Improper Validation of Specified Type of Input
CWE-1287.description: The product receives input that is expected to be of a certain type, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input is actually of the expected type.

CWE-1288.name: Improper Validation of Consistency within Input
CWE-1288.description: The product receives a complex input with multiple elements or fields that must be consistent with each other, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input is actually consistent.

CWE-1289.name: Improper Validation of Unsafe Equivalence in Input
CWE-1289.description: The product receives an input value that is used as a resource identifier or other type of reference, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input is equivalent to a potentially-unsafe value.

CWE-130.name: Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency
CWE-130.description: The product parses a formatted message or structure, but it does not handle or incorrectly handles a length field that is inconsistent with the actual length of the associated data.

CWE-131.name: Incorrect Calculation of Buffer Size
CWE-131.description: The product does not correctly calculate the size to be used when allocating a buffer, which could lead to a buffer overflow.

CWE-1322.name: Use of Blocking Code in Single-threaded, Non-blocking Context
CWE-1322.description: The product uses a non-blocking model that relies on a single threaded process for features such as scalability, but it contains code that can block when it is invoked.

CWE-1327.name: Binding to an Unrestricted IP Address
CWE-1327.description: The product assigns the address 0.0.0.0 for a database server, a cloud service/instance, or any computing resource that communicates remotely.

CWE-1333.name: Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity
CWE-1333.description: The product uses a regular expression with an inefficient, possibly exponential worst-case computational complexity that consumes excessive CPU cycles.

CWE-1335.name: Incorrect Bitwise Shift of Integer
CWE-1335.description: An integer value is specified to be shifted by a negative amount or an amount greater than or equal to the number of bits contained in the value causing an unexpected or indeterminate result.

CWE-1339.name: Insufficient Precision or Accuracy of a Real Number
CWE-1339.description: The product processes a real number with an implementation in which the number's representation does not preserve required accuracy and precision in its fractional part, causing an incorrect result.

CWE-134.name: Use of Externally-Controlled Format String
CWE-134.description: The product uses a function that accepts a format string as an argument, but the format string originates from an external source.

CWE-1341.name: Multiple Releases of Same Resource or Handle
CWE-1341.description: The product attempts to close or release a resource or handle more than once, without any successful open between the close operations.

CWE-135.name: Incorrect Calculation of Multi-Byte String Length
CWE-135.description: The product does not correctly calculate the length of strings that can contain wide or multi-byte characters.

CWE-1389.name: Incorrect Parsing of Numbers with Different Radices
CWE-1389.description: The product parses numeric input assuming base 10 (decimal) values, but it does not account for inputs that use a different base number (radix).

CWE-1392.name: Use of Default Credentials
CWE-1392.description: The product uses default credentials (such as passwords or cryptographic keys) for potentially critical functionality.

CWE-140.name: Improper Neutralization of Delimiters
CWE-140.description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes delimiters.

CWE-15.name: External Control of System or Configuration Setting
CWE-15.description: One or more system settings or configuration elements can be externally controlled by a user.

CWE-166.name: Improper Handling of Missing Special Element
CWE-166.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not handle or incorrectly handles when an expected special element is missing.

CWE-167.name: Improper Handling of Additional Special Element
CWE-167.description: The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not handle or incorrectly handles when an additional unexpected special element is provided.

CWE-168.name: Improper Handling of Inconsistent Special Elements
CWE-168.description: The product does not properly handle input in which an inconsistency exists between two or more special characters or reserved words.

CWE-170.name: Improper Null Termination
CWE-170.description: The product does not terminate or incorrectly terminates a string or array with a null character or equivalent terminator.

CWE-178.name: Improper Handling of Case Sensitivity
CWE-178.description: The product does not properly account for differences in case sensitivity when accessing or determining the properties of a resource, leading to inconsistent results.

CWE-179.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Early Validation
CWE-179.description: The product validates input before applying protection mechanisms that modify the input, which could allow an attacker to bypass the validation via dangerous inputs that only arise after the modification.

CWE-182.name: Collapse of Data into Unsafe Value
CWE-182.description: The product filters data in a way that causes it to be reduced or "collapsed" into an unsafe value that violates an expected security property.

CWE-183.name: Permissive List of Allowed Inputs
CWE-183.description: The product implements a protection mechanism that relies on a list of inputs (or properties of inputs) that are explicitly allowed by policy because the inputs are assumed to be safe, but the list is too permissive - that is, it allows an input that is unsafe, leading to resultant weaknesses.

CWE-184.name: Incomplete List of Disallowed Inputs
CWE-184.description: The product implements a protection mechanism that relies on a list of inputs (or properties of inputs) that are not allowed by policy or otherwise require other action to neutralize before additional processing takes place, but the list is incomplete.

CWE-186.name: Overly Restrictive Regular Expression
CWE-186.description: A regular expression is overly restrictive, which prevents dangerous values from being detected.

CWE-190.name: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
CWE-190.description: The product performs a calculation that can produce an integer overflow or wraparound when the logic assumes that the resulting value will always be larger than the original value. This occurs when an integer value is incremented to a value that is too large to store in the associated representation. When this occurs, the value may become a very small or negative number.

CWE-191.name: Integer Underflow (Wrap or Wraparound)
CWE-191.description: The product subtracts one value from another, such that the result is less than the minimum allowable integer value, which produces a value that is not equal to the correct result.

CWE-193.name: Off-by-one Error
CWE-193.description: A product calculates or uses an incorrect maximum or minimum value that is 1 more, or 1 less, than the correct value.

CWE-201.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data
CWE-201.description: The code transmits data to another actor, but a portion of the data includes sensitive information that should not be accessible to that actor.

CWE-204.name: Observable Response Discrepancy
CWE-204.description: The product provides different responses to incoming requests in a way that reveals internal state information to an unauthorized actor outside of the intended control sphere.

CWE-205.name: Observable Behavioral Discrepancy
CWE-205.description: The product's behaviors indicate important differences that may be observed by unauthorized actors in a way that reveals (1) its internal state or decision process, or (2) differences from other products with equivalent functionality.

CWE-208.name: Observable Timing Discrepancy
CWE-208.description: Two separate operations in a product require different amounts of time to complete, in a way that is observable to an actor and reveals security-relevant information about the state of the product, such as whether a particular operation was successful or not.

CWE-209.name: Generation of Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
CWE-209.description: The product generates an error message that includes sensitive information about its environment, users, or associated data.

CWE-212.name: Improper Removal of Sensitive Information Before Storage or Transfer
CWE-212.description: The product stores, transfers, or shares a resource that contains sensitive information, but it does not properly remove that information before the product makes the resource available to unauthorized actors.

CWE-213.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information Due to Incompatible Policies
CWE-213.description: The product's intended functionality exposes information to certain actors in accordance with the developer's security policy, but this information is regarded as sensitive according to the intended security policies of other stakeholders such as the product's administrator, users, or others whose information is being processed.

CWE-214.name: Invocation of Process Using Visible Sensitive Information
CWE-214.description: A process is invoked with sensitive command-line arguments, environment variables, or other elements that can be seen by other processes on the operating system.

CWE-215.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Debugging Code
CWE-215.description: The product inserts sensitive information into debugging code, which could expose this information if the debugging code is not disabled in production.

CWE-22.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
CWE-22.description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that is intended to identify a file or directory that is located underneath a restricted parent directory, but the product does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location that is outside of the restricted directory.

CWE-222.name: Truncation of Security-relevant Information
CWE-222.description: The product truncates the display, recording, or processing of security-relevant information in a way that can obscure the source or nature of an attack.

CWE-223.name: Omission of Security-relevant Information
CWE-223.description: The product does not record or display information that would be important for identifying the source or nature of an attack, or determining if an action is safe.

CWE-224.name: Obscured Security-relevant Information by Alternate Name
CWE-224.description: The product records security-relevant information according to an alternate name of the affected entity, instead of the canonical name.

CWE-229.name: Improper Handling of Values
CWE-229.description: The product does not properly handle when the expected number of values for parameters, fields, or arguments is not provided in input, or if those values are undefined.

CWE-233.name: Improper Handling of Parameters
CWE-233.description: The product does not properly handle when the expected number of parameters, fields, or arguments is not provided in input, or if those parameters are undefined.

CWE-237.name: Improper Handling of Structural Elements
CWE-237.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles inputs that are related to complex structures.

CWE-241.name: Improper Handling of Unexpected Data Type
CWE-241.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when a particular element is not the expected type, e.g. it expects a digit (0-9) but is provided with a letter (A-Z).

CWE-242.name: Use of Inherently Dangerous Function
CWE-242.description: The product calls a function that can never be guaranteed to work safely.

CWE-243.name: Creation of chroot Jail Without Changing Working Directory
CWE-243.description: The product uses the chroot() system call to create a jail, but does not change the working directory afterward. This does not prevent access to files outside of the jail.

CWE-248.name: Uncaught Exception
CWE-248.description: An exception is thrown from a function, but it is not caught.

CWE-250.name: Execution with Unnecessary Privileges
CWE-250.description: The product performs an operation at a privilege level that is higher than the minimum level required, which creates new weaknesses or amplifies the consequences of other weaknesses.

CWE-252.name: Unchecked Return Value
CWE-252.description: The product does not check the return value from a method or function, which can prevent it from detecting unexpected states and conditions.

CWE-253.name: Incorrect Check of Function Return Value
CWE-253.description: The product incorrectly checks a return value from a function, which prevents it from detecting errors or exceptional conditions.

CWE-256.name: Plaintext Storage of a Password
CWE-256.description: The product stores a password in plaintext within resources such as memory or files.

CWE-257.name: Storing Passwords in a Recoverable Format
CWE-257.description: The storage of passwords in a recoverable format makes them subject to password reuse attacks by malicious users. In fact, it should be noted that recoverable encrypted passwords provide no significant benefit over plaintext passwords since they are subject not only to reuse by malicious attackers but also by malicious insiders. If a system administrator can recover a password directly, or use a brute force search on the available information, the administrator can use the password on other accounts.

CWE-260.name: Password in Configuration File
CWE-260.description: The product stores a password in a configuration file that might be accessible to actors who do not know the password.

CWE-261.name: Weak Encoding for Password
CWE-261.description: Obscuring a password with a trivial encoding does not protect the password.

CWE-262.name: Not Using Password Aging
CWE-262.description: The product does not have a mechanism in place for managing password aging.

CWE-263.name: Password Aging with Long Expiration
CWE-263.description: The product supports password aging, but the expiration period is too long.

CWE-266.name: Incorrect Privilege Assignment
CWE-266.description: A product incorrectly assigns a privilege to a particular actor, creating an unintended sphere of control for that actor.

CWE-267.name: Privilege Defined With Unsafe Actions
CWE-267.description: A particular privilege, role, capability, or right can be used to perform unsafe actions that were not intended, even when it is assigned to the correct entity.

CWE-268.name: Privilege Chaining
CWE-268.description: Two distinct privileges, roles, capabilities, or rights can be combined in a way that allows an entity to perform unsafe actions that would not be allowed without that combination.

CWE-270.name: Privilege Context Switching Error
CWE-270.description: The product does not properly manage privileges while it is switching between different contexts that have different privileges or spheres of control.

CWE-272.name: Least Privilege Violation
CWE-272.description: The elevated privilege level required to perform operations such as chroot() should be dropped immediately after the operation is performed.

CWE-273.name: Improper Check for Dropped Privileges
CWE-273.description: The product attempts to drop privileges but does not check or incorrectly checks to see if the drop succeeded.

CWE-274.name: Improper Handling of Insufficient Privileges
CWE-274.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when it has insufficient privileges to perform an operation, leading to resultant weaknesses.

CWE-276.name: Incorrect Default Permissions
CWE-276.description: During installation, installed file permissions are set to allow anyone to modify those files.

CWE-277.name: Insecure Inherited Permissions
CWE-277.description: A product defines a set of insecure permissions that are inherited by objects that are created by the program.

CWE-278.name: Insecure Preserved Inherited Permissions
CWE-278.description: A product inherits a set of insecure permissions for an object, e.g. when copying from an archive file, without user awareness or involvement.

CWE-279.name: Incorrect Execution-Assigned Permissions
CWE-279.description: While it is executing, the product sets the permissions of an object in a way that violates the intended permissions that have been specified by the user.

CWE-280.name: Improper Handling of Insufficient Permissions or Privileges
CWE-280.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles when it has insufficient privileges to access resources or functionality as specified by their permissions. This may cause it to follow unexpected code paths that may leave the product in an invalid state.

CWE-281.name: Improper Preservation of Permissions
CWE-281.description: The product does not preserve permissions or incorrectly preserves permissions when copying, restoring, or sharing objects, which can cause them to have less restrictive permissions than intended.

CWE-283.name: Unverified Ownership
CWE-283.description: The product does not properly verify that a critical resource is owned by the proper entity.

CWE-289.name: Authentication Bypass by Alternate Name
CWE-289.description: The product performs authentication based on the name of a resource being accessed, or the name of the actor performing the access, but it does not properly check all possible names for that resource or actor.

CWE-290.name: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
CWE-290.description: This attack-focused weakness is caused by incorrectly implemented authentication schemes that are subject to spoofing attacks.

CWE-294.name: Authentication Bypass by Capture-replay
CWE-294.description: A capture-replay flaw exists when the design of the product makes it possible for a malicious user to sniff network traffic and bypass authentication by replaying it to the server in question to the same effect as the original message (or with minor changes).

CWE-295.name: Improper Certificate Validation
CWE-295.description: The product does not validate, or incorrectly validates, a certificate.

CWE-301.name: Reflection Attack in an Authentication Protocol
CWE-301.description: Simple authentication protocols are subject to reflection attacks if a malicious user can use the target machine to impersonate a trusted user.

CWE-303.name: Incorrect Implementation of Authentication Algorithm
CWE-303.description: The requirements for the product dictate the use of an established authentication algorithm, but the implementation of the algorithm is incorrect.

CWE-305.name: Authentication Bypass by Primary Weakness
CWE-305.description: The authentication algorithm is sound, but the implemented mechanism can be bypassed as the result of a separate weakness that is primary to the authentication error.

CWE-306.name: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
CWE-306.description: The product does not perform any authentication for functionality that requires a provable user identity or consumes a significant amount of resources.

CWE-307.name: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts
CWE-307.description: The product does not implement sufficient measures to prevent multiple failed authentication attempts within a short time frame.

CWE-308.name: Use of Single-factor Authentication
CWE-308.description: The product uses an authentication algorithm that uses a single factor (e.g., a password) in a security context that should require more than one factor.

CWE-309.name: Use of Password System for Primary Authentication
CWE-309.description: The use of password systems as the primary means of authentication may be subject to several flaws or shortcomings, each reducing the effectiveness of the mechanism.

CWE-312.name: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
CWE-312.description: The product stores sensitive information in cleartext within a resource that might be accessible to another control sphere.

CWE-319.name: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
CWE-319.description: The product transmits sensitive or security-critical data in cleartext in a communication channel that can be sniffed by unauthorized actors.

CWE-322.name: Key Exchange without Entity Authentication
CWE-322.description: The product performs a key exchange with an actor without verifying the identity of that actor.

CWE-323.name: Reusing a Nonce, Key Pair in Encryption
CWE-323.description: Nonces should be used for the present occasion and only once.

CWE-324.name: Use of a Key Past its Expiration Date
CWE-324.description: The product uses a cryptographic key or password past its expiration date, which diminishes its safety significantly by increasing the timing window for cracking attacks against that key.

CWE-325.name: Missing Cryptographic Step
CWE-325.description: The product does not implement a required step in a cryptographic algorithm, resulting in weaker encryption than advertised by the algorithm.

CWE-328.name: Use of Weak Hash
CWE-328.description: The product uses an algorithm that produces a digest (output value) that does not meet security expectations for a hash function that allows an adversary to reasonably determine the original input (preimage attack), find another input that can produce the same hash (2nd preimage attack), or find multiple inputs that evaluate to the same hash (birthday attack).

CWE-331.name: Insufficient Entropy
CWE-331.description: The product uses an algorithm or scheme that produces insufficient entropy, leaving patterns or clusters of values that are more likely to occur than others.

CWE-334.name: Small Space of Random Values
CWE-334.description: The number of possible random values is smaller than needed by the product, making it more susceptible to brute force attacks.

CWE-335.name: Incorrect Usage of Seeds in Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
CWE-335.description: The product uses a Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG) but does not correctly manage seeds.

CWE-338.name: Use of Cryptographically Weak Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG)
CWE-338.description: The product uses a Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG) in a security context, but the PRNG's algorithm is not cryptographically strong.

CWE-341.name: Predictable from Observable State
CWE-341.description: A number or object is predictable based on observations that the attacker can make about the state of the system or network, such as time, process ID, etc.

CWE-342.name: Predictable Exact Value from Previous Values
CWE-342.description: An exact value or random number can be precisely predicted by observing previous values.

CWE-343.name: Predictable Value Range from Previous Values
CWE-343.description: The product's random number generator produces a series of values which, when observed, can be used to infer a relatively small range of possibilities for the next value that could be generated.

CWE-344.name: Use of Invariant Value in Dynamically Changing Context
CWE-344.description: The product uses a constant value, name, or reference, but this value can (or should) vary across different environments.

CWE-346.name: Origin Validation Error
CWE-346.description: The product does not properly verify that the source of data or communication is valid.

CWE-347.name: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
CWE-347.description: The product does not verify, or incorrectly verifies, the cryptographic signature for data.

CWE-348.name: Use of Less Trusted Source
CWE-348.description: The product has two different sources of the same data or information, but it uses the source that has less support for verification, is less trusted, or is less resistant to attack.

CWE-349.name: Acceptance of Extraneous Untrusted Data With Trusted Data
CWE-349.description: The product, when processing trusted data, accepts any untrusted data that is also included with the trusted data, treating the untrusted data as if it were trusted.

CWE-351.name: Insufficient Type Distinction
CWE-351.description: The product does not properly distinguish between different types of elements in a way that leads to insecure behavior.

CWE-353.name: Missing Support for Integrity Check
CWE-353.description: The product uses a transmission protocol that does not include a mechanism for verifying the integrity of the data during transmission, such as a checksum.

CWE-354.name: Improper Validation of Integrity Check Value
CWE-354.description: The product does not validate or incorrectly validates the integrity check values or "checksums" of a message. This may prevent it from detecting if the data has been modified or corrupted in transmission.

CWE-356.name: Product UI does not Warn User of Unsafe Actions
CWE-356.description: The product's user interface does not warn the user before undertaking an unsafe action on behalf of that user. This makes it easier for attackers to trick users into inflicting damage to their system.

CWE-357.name: Insufficient UI Warning of Dangerous Operations
CWE-357.description: The user interface provides a warning to a user regarding dangerous or sensitive operations, but the warning is not noticeable enough to warrant attention.

CWE-358.name: Improperly Implemented Security Check for Standard
CWE-358.description: The product does not implement or incorrectly implements one or more security-relevant checks as specified by the design of a standardized algorithm, protocol, or technique.

CWE-359.name: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
CWE-359.description: The product does not properly prevent a person's private, personal information from being accessed by actors who either (1) are not explicitly authorized to access the information or (2) do not have the implicit consent of the person about whom the information is collected.

CWE-360.name: Trust of System Event Data
CWE-360.description: Security based on event locations are insecure and can be spoofed.

CWE-364.name: Signal Handler Race Condition
CWE-364.description: The product uses a signal handler that introduces a race condition.

CWE-366.name: Race Condition within a Thread
CWE-366.description: If two threads of execution use a resource simultaneously, there exists the possibility that resources may be used while invalid, in turn making the state of execution undefined.

CWE-367.name: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition
CWE-367.description: The product checks the state of a resource before using that resource, but the resource's state can change between the check and the use in a way that invalidates the results of the check.

CWE-368.name: Context Switching Race Condition
CWE-368.description: A product performs a series of non-atomic actions to switch between contexts that cross privilege or other security boundaries, but a race condition allows an attacker to modify or misrepresent the product's behavior during the switch.

CWE-369.name: Divide By Zero
CWE-369.description: The product divides a value by zero.

CWE-372.name: Incomplete Internal State Distinction
CWE-372.description: The product does not properly determine which state it is in, causing it to assume it is in state X when in fact it is in state Y, causing it to perform incorrect operations in a security-relevant manner.

CWE-374.name: Passing Mutable Objects to an Untrusted Method
CWE-374.description: The product sends non-cloned mutable data as an argument to a method or function.

CWE-375.name: Returning a Mutable Object to an Untrusted Caller
CWE-375.description: Sending non-cloned mutable data as a return value may result in that data being altered or deleted by the calling function.

CWE-378.name: Creation of Temporary File With Insecure Permissions
CWE-378.description: Opening temporary files without appropriate measures or controls can leave the file, its contents and any function that it impacts vulnerable to attack.

CWE-379.name: Creation of Temporary File in Directory with Insecure Permissions
CWE-379.description: The product creates a temporary file in a directory whose permissions allow unintended actors to determine the file's existence or otherwise access that file.

CWE-385.name: Covert Timing Channel
CWE-385.description: Covert timing channels convey information by modulating some aspect of system behavior over time, so that the program receiving the information can observe system behavior and infer protected information.

CWE-386.name: Symbolic Name not Mapping to Correct Object
CWE-386.description: A constant symbolic reference to an object is used, even though the reference can resolve to a different object over time.

CWE-390.name: Detection of Error Condition Without Action
CWE-390.description: The product detects a specific error, but takes no actions to handle the error.

CWE-391.name: Unchecked Error Condition
CWE-391.description: [PLANNED FOR DEPRECATION. SEE MAINTENANCE NOTES AND CONSIDER CWE-252, CWE-248, OR CWE-1069.] Ignoring exceptions and other error conditions may allow an attacker to induce unexpected behavior unnoticed.

CWE-392.name: Missing Report of Error Condition
CWE-392.description: The product encounters an error but does not provide a status code or return value to indicate that an error has occurred.

CWE-393.name: Return of Wrong Status Code
CWE-393.description: A function or operation returns an incorrect return value or status code that does not indicate the true result of execution, causing the product to modify its behavior based on the incorrect result.

CWE-394.name: Unexpected Status Code or Return Value
CWE-394.description: The product does not properly check when a function or operation returns a value that is legitimate for the function, but is not expected by the product.

CWE-395.name: Use of NullPointerException Catch to Detect NULL Pointer Dereference
CWE-395.description: Catching NullPointerException should not be used as an alternative to programmatic checks to prevent dereferencing a null pointer.

CWE-396.name: Declaration of Catch for Generic Exception
CWE-396.description: Catching overly broad exceptions promotes complex error handling code that is more likely to contain security vulnerabilities.

CWE-397.name: Declaration of Throws for Generic Exception
CWE-397.description: The product throws or raises an overly broad exceptions that can hide important details and produce inappropriate responses to certain conditions.

CWE-403.name: Exposure of File Descriptor to Unintended Control Sphere ('File Descriptor Leak')
CWE-403.description: A process does not close sensitive file descriptors before invoking a child process, which allows the child to perform unauthorized I/O operations using those descriptors.

CWE-408.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Early Amplification
CWE-408.description: The product allows an entity to perform a legitimate but expensive operation before authentication or authorization has taken place.

CWE-409.name: Improper Handling of Highly Compressed Data (Data Amplification)
CWE-409.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles a compressed input with a very high compression ratio that produces a large output.

CWE-41.name: Improper Resolution of Path Equivalence
CWE-41.description: The product is vulnerable to file system contents disclosure through path equivalence. Path equivalence involves the use of special characters in file and directory names. The associated manipulations are intended to generate multiple names for the same object.

CWE-410.name: Insufficient Resource Pool
CWE-410.description: The product's resource pool is not large enough to handle peak demand, which allows an attacker to prevent others from accessing the resource by using a (relatively) large number of requests for resources.

CWE-412.name: Unrestricted Externally Accessible Lock
CWE-412.description: The product properly checks for the existence of a lock, but the lock can be externally controlled or influenced by an actor that is outside of the intended sphere of control.

CWE-413.name: Improper Resource Locking
CWE-413.description: The product does not lock or does not correctly lock a resource when the product must have exclusive access to the resource.

CWE-414.name: Missing Lock Check
CWE-414.description: A product does not check to see if a lock is present before performing sensitive operations on a resource.

CWE-419.name: Unprotected Primary Channel
CWE-419.description: The product uses a primary channel for administration or restricted functionality, but it does not properly protect the channel.

CWE-420.name: Unprotected Alternate Channel
CWE-420.description: The product protects a primary channel, but it does not use the same level of protection for an alternate channel.

CWE-421.name: Race Condition During Access to Alternate Channel
CWE-421.description: The product opens an alternate channel to communicate with an authorized user, but the channel is accessible to other actors.

CWE-425.name: Direct Request ('Forced Browsing')
CWE-425.description: The web application does not adequately enforce appropriate authorization on all restricted URLs, scripts, or files.

CWE-426.name: Untrusted Search Path
CWE-426.description: The product searches for critical resources using an externally-supplied search path that can point to resources that are not under the product's direct control.

CWE-427.name: Uncontrolled Search Path Element
CWE-427.description: The product uses a fixed or controlled search path to find resources, but one or more locations in that path can be under the control of unintended actors.

CWE-428.name: Unquoted Search Path or Element
CWE-428.description: The product uses a search path that contains an unquoted element, in which the element contains whitespace or other separators. This can cause the product to access resources in a parent path.

CWE-430.name: Deployment of Wrong Handler
CWE-430.description: The wrong "handler" is assigned to process an object.

CWE-431.name: Missing Handler
CWE-431.description: A handler is not available or implemented.

CWE-434.name: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
CWE-434.description: The product allows the upload or transfer of dangerous file types that are automatically processed within its environment.

CWE-437.name: Incomplete Model of Endpoint Features
CWE-437.description: A product acts as an intermediary or monitor between two or more endpoints, but it does not have a complete model of an endpoint's features, behaviors, or state, potentially causing the product to perform incorrect actions based on this incomplete model.

CWE-439.name: Behavioral Change in New Version or Environment
CWE-439.description: A's behavior or functionality changes with a new version of A, or a new environment, which is not known (or manageable) by B.

CWE-440.name: Expected Behavior Violation
CWE-440.description: A feature, API, or function does not perform according to its specification.

CWE-444.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')
CWE-444.description: The product acts as an intermediary HTTP agent (such as a proxy or firewall) in the data flow between two entities such as a client and server, but it does not interpret malformed HTTP requests or responses in ways that are consistent with how the messages will be processed by those entities that are at the ultimate destination.

CWE-447.name: Unimplemented or Unsupported Feature in UI
CWE-447.description: A UI function for a security feature appears to be supported and gives feedback to the user that suggests that it is supported, but the underlying functionality is not implemented.

CWE-448.name: Obsolete Feature in UI
CWE-448.description: A UI function is obsolete and the product does not warn the user.

CWE-449.name: The UI Performs the Wrong Action
CWE-449.description: The UI performs the wrong action with respect to the user's request.

CWE-454.name: External Initialization of Trusted Variables or Data Stores
CWE-454.description: The product initializes critical internal variables or data stores using inputs that can be modified by untrusted actors.

CWE-455.name: Non-exit on Failed Initialization
CWE-455.description: The product does not exit or otherwise modify its operation when security-relevant errors occur during initialization, such as when a configuration file has a format error or a hardware security module (HSM) cannot be activated, which can cause the product to execute in a less secure fashion than intended by the administrator.

CWE-459.name: Incomplete Cleanup
CWE-459.description: The product does not properly "clean up" and remove temporary or supporting resources after they have been used.

CWE-463.name: Deletion of Data Structure Sentinel
CWE-463.description: The accidental deletion of a data-structure sentinel can cause serious programming logic problems.

CWE-464.name: Addition of Data Structure Sentinel
CWE-464.description: The accidental addition of a data-structure sentinel can cause serious programming logic problems.

CWE-466.name: Return of Pointer Value Outside of Expected Range
CWE-466.description: A function can return a pointer to memory that is outside of the buffer that the pointer is expected to reference.

CWE-468.name: Incorrect Pointer Scaling
CWE-468.description: In C and C++, one may often accidentally refer to the wrong memory due to the semantics of when math operations are implicitly scaled.

CWE-469.name: Use of Pointer Subtraction to Determine Size
CWE-469.description: The product subtracts one pointer from another in order to determine size, but this calculation can be incorrect if the pointers do not exist in the same memory chunk.

CWE-470.name: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection')
CWE-470.description: The product uses external input with reflection to select which classes or code to use, but it does not sufficiently prevent the input from selecting improper classes or code.

CWE-472.name: External Control of Assumed-Immutable Web Parameter
CWE-472.description: The web application does not sufficiently verify inputs that are assumed to be immutable but are actually externally controllable, such as hidden form fields.

CWE-474.name: Use of Function with Inconsistent Implementations
CWE-474.description: The code uses a function that has inconsistent implementations across operating systems and versions.

CWE-475.name: Undefined Behavior for Input to API
CWE-475.description: The behavior of this function is undefined unless its control parameter is set to a specific value.

CWE-476.name: NULL Pointer Dereference
CWE-476.description: The product dereferences a pointer that it expects to be valid but is NULL.

CWE-477.name: Use of Obsolete Function
CWE-477.description: The code uses deprecated or obsolete functions, which suggests that the code has not been actively reviewed or maintained.

CWE-478.name: Missing Default Case in Multiple Condition Expression
CWE-478.description: The code does not have a default case in an expression with multiple conditions, such as a switch statement.

CWE-480.name: Use of Incorrect Operator
CWE-480.description: The product accidentally uses the wrong operator, which changes the logic in security-relevant ways.

CWE-483.name: Incorrect Block Delimitation
CWE-483.description: The code does not explicitly delimit a block that is intended to contain 2 or more statements, creating a logic error.

CWE-484.name: Omitted Break Statement in Switch
CWE-484.description: The product omits a break statement within a switch or similar construct, causing code associated with multiple conditions to execute. This can cause problems when the programmer only intended to execute code associated with one condition.

CWE-487.name: Reliance on Package-level Scope
CWE-487.description: Java packages are not inherently closed; therefore, relying on them for code security is not a good practice.

CWE-488.name: Exposure of Data Element to Wrong Session
CWE-488.description: The product does not sufficiently enforce boundaries between the states of different sessions, causing data to be provided to, or used by, the wrong session.

CWE-489.name: Active Debug Code
CWE-489.description: The product is released with debugging code still enabled or active.

CWE-494.name: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
CWE-494.description: The product downloads source code or an executable from a remote location and executes the code without sufficiently verifying the origin and integrity of the code.

CWE-497.name: Exposure of Sensitive System Information to an Unauthorized Control Sphere
CWE-497.description: The product does not properly prevent sensitive system-level information from being accessed by unauthorized actors who do not have the same level of access to the underlying system as the product does.

CWE-501.name: Trust Boundary Violation
CWE-501.description: The product mixes trusted and untrusted data in the same data structure or structured message.

CWE-502.name: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
CWE-502.description: The product deserializes untrusted data without sufficiently ensuring that the resulting data will be valid.

CWE-515.name: Covert Storage Channel
CWE-515.description: A covert storage channel transfers information through the setting of bits by one program and the reading of those bits by another. What distinguishes this case from that of ordinary operation is that the bits are used to convey encoded information.

CWE-521.name: Weak Password Requirements
CWE-521.description: The product does not require that users should have strong passwords.

CWE-523.name: Unprotected Transport of Credentials
CWE-523.description: Login pages do not use adequate measures to protect the user name and password while they are in transit from the client to the server.

CWE-524.name: Use of Cache Containing Sensitive Information
CWE-524.description: The code uses a cache that contains sensitive information, but the cache can be read by an actor outside of the intended control sphere.

CWE-538.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Externally-Accessible File or Directory
CWE-538.description: The product places sensitive information into files or directories that are accessible to actors who are allowed to have access to the files, but not to the sensitive information.

CWE-544.name: Missing Standardized Error Handling Mechanism
CWE-544.description: The product does not use a standardized method for handling errors throughout the code, which might introduce inconsistent error handling and resultant weaknesses.

CWE-547.name: Use of Hard-coded, Security-relevant Constants
CWE-547.description: The product uses hard-coded constants instead of symbolic names for security-critical values, which increases the likelihood of mistakes during code maintenance or security policy change.

CWE-549.name: Missing Password Field Masking
CWE-549.description: The product does not mask passwords during entry, increasing the potential for attackers to observe and capture passwords.

CWE-551.name: Incorrect Behavior Order: Authorization Before Parsing and Canonicalization
CWE-551.description: If a web server does not fully parse requested URLs before it examines them for authorization, it may be possible for an attacker to bypass authorization protection.

CWE-552.name: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
CWE-552.description: The product makes files or directories accessible to unauthorized actors, even though they should not be.

CWE-561.name: Dead Code
CWE-561.description: The product contains dead code, which can never be executed.

CWE-562.name: Return of Stack Variable Address
CWE-562.description: A function returns the address of a stack variable, which will cause unintended program behavior, typically in the form of a crash.

CWE-563.name: Assignment to Variable without Use
CWE-563.description: The variable's value is assigned but never used, making it a dead store.

CWE-565.name: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking
CWE-565.description: The product relies on the existence or values of cookies when performing security-critical operations, but it does not properly ensure that the setting is valid for the associated user.

CWE-570.name: Expression is Always False
CWE-570.description: The product contains an expression that will always evaluate to false.

CWE-571.name: Expression is Always True
CWE-571.description: The product contains an expression that will always evaluate to true.

CWE-580.name: clone() Method Without super.clone()
CWE-580.description: The product contains a clone() method that does not call super.clone() to obtain the new object.

CWE-581.name: Object Model Violation: Just One of Equals and Hashcode Defined
CWE-581.description: The product does not maintain equal hashcodes for equal objects.

CWE-584.name: Return Inside Finally Block
CWE-584.description: The code has a return statement inside a finally block, which will cause any thrown exception in the try block to be discarded.

CWE-586.name: Explicit Call to Finalize()
CWE-586.description: The product makes an explicit call to the finalize() method from outside the finalizer.

CWE-587.name: Assignment of a Fixed Address to a Pointer
CWE-587.description: The product sets a pointer to a specific address other than NULL or 0.

CWE-59.name: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
CWE-59.description: The product attempts to access a file based on the filename, but it does not properly prevent that filename from identifying a link or shortcut that resolves to an unintended resource.

CWE-601.name: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
CWE-601.description: The web application accepts a user-controlled input that specifies a link to an external site, and uses that link in a redirect.

CWE-603.name: Use of Client-Side Authentication
CWE-603.description: A client/server product performs authentication within client code but not in server code, allowing server-side authentication to be bypassed via a modified client that omits the authentication check.

CWE-605.name: Multiple Binds to the Same Port
CWE-605.description: When multiple sockets are allowed to bind to the same port, other services on that port may be stolen or spoofed.

CWE-606.name: Unchecked Input for Loop Condition
CWE-606.description: The product does not properly check inputs that are used for loop conditions, potentially leading to a denial of service or other consequences because of excessive looping.

CWE-609.name: Double-Checked Locking
CWE-609.description: The product uses double-checked locking to access a resource without the overhead of explicit synchronization, but the locking is insufficient.

CWE-611.name: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference
CWE-611.description: The product processes an XML document that can contain XML entities with URIs that resolve to documents outside of the intended sphere of control, causing the product to embed incorrect documents into its output.

CWE-613.name: Insufficient Session Expiration
CWE-613.description: According to WASC, "Insufficient Session Expiration is when a web site permits an attacker to reuse old session credentials or session IDs for authorization."

CWE-617.name: Reachable Assertion
CWE-617.description: The product contains an assert() or similar statement that can be triggered by an attacker, which leads to an application exit or other behavior that is more severe than necessary.

CWE-618.name: Exposed Unsafe ActiveX Method
CWE-618.description: An ActiveX control is intended for use in a web browser, but it exposes dangerous methods that perform actions that are outside of the browser's security model (e.g. the zone or domain).

CWE-619.name: Dangling Database Cursor ('Cursor Injection')
CWE-619.description: If a database cursor is not closed properly, then it could become accessible to other users while retaining the same privileges that were originally assigned, leaving the cursor "dangling."

CWE-620.name: Unverified Password Change
CWE-620.description: When setting a new password for a user, the product does not require knowledge of the original password, or using another form of authentication.

CWE-624.name: Executable Regular Expression Error
CWE-624.description: The product uses a regular expression that either (1) contains an executable component with user-controlled inputs, or (2) allows a user to enable execution by inserting pattern modifiers.

CWE-625.name: Permissive Regular Expression
CWE-625.description: The product uses a regular expression that does not sufficiently restrict the set of allowed values.

CWE-628.name: Function Call with Incorrectly Specified Arguments
CWE-628.description: The product calls a function, procedure, or routine with arguments that are not correctly specified, leading to always-incorrect behavior and resultant weaknesses.

CWE-639.name: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
CWE-639.description: The system's authorization functionality does not prevent one user from gaining access to another user's data or record by modifying the key value identifying the data.

CWE-640.name: Weak Password Recovery Mechanism for Forgotten Password
CWE-640.description: The product contains a mechanism for users to recover or change their passwords without knowing the original password, but the mechanism is weak.

CWE-641.name: Improper Restriction of Names for Files and Other Resources
CWE-641.description: The product constructs the name of a file or other resource using input from an upstream component, but it does not restrict or incorrectly restricts the resulting name.

CWE-645.name: Overly Restrictive Account Lockout Mechanism
CWE-645.description: The product contains an account lockout protection mechanism, but the mechanism is too restrictive and can be triggered too easily, which allows attackers to deny service to legitimate users by causing their accounts to be locked out.

CWE-648.name: Incorrect Use of Privileged APIs
CWE-648.description: The product does not conform to the API requirements for a function call that requires extra privileges. This could allow attackers to gain privileges by causing the function to be called incorrectly.

CWE-649.name: Reliance on Obfuscation or Encryption of Security-Relevant Inputs without Integrity Checking
CWE-649.description: The product uses obfuscation or encryption of inputs that should not be mutable by an external actor, but the product does not use integrity checks to detect if those inputs have been modified.

CWE-653.name: Improper Isolation or Compartmentalization
CWE-653.description: The product does not properly compartmentalize or isolate functionality, processes, or resources that require different privilege levels, rights, or permissions.

CWE-654.name: Reliance on a Single Factor in a Security Decision
CWE-654.description: A protection mechanism relies exclusively, or to a large extent, on the evaluation of a single condition or the integrity of a single object or entity in order to make a decision about granting access to restricted resources or functionality.

CWE-656.name: Reliance on Security Through Obscurity
CWE-656.description: The product uses a protection mechanism whose strength depends heavily on its obscurity, such that knowledge of its algorithms or key data is sufficient to defeat the mechanism.

CWE-66.name: Improper Handling of File Names that Identify Virtual Resources
CWE-66.description: The product does not handle or incorrectly handles a file name that identifies a "virtual" resource that is not directly specified within the directory that is associated with the file name, causing the product to perform file-based operations on a resource that is not a file.

CWE-663.name: Use of a Non-reentrant Function in a Concurrent Context
CWE-663.description: The product calls a non-reentrant function in a concurrent context in which a competing code sequence (e.g. thread or signal handler) may have an opportunity to call the same function or otherwise influence its state.

CWE-676.name: Use of Potentially Dangerous Function
CWE-676.description: The product invokes a potentially dangerous function that could introduce a vulnerability if it is used incorrectly, but the function can also be used safely.

CWE-681.name: Incorrect Conversion between Numeric Types
CWE-681.description: When converting from one data type to another, such as long to integer, data can be omitted or translated in a way that produces unexpected values. If the resulting values are used in a sensitive context, then dangerous behaviors may occur.

CWE-694.name: Use of Multiple Resources with Duplicate Identifier
CWE-694.description: The product uses multiple resources that can have the same identifier, in a context in which unique identifiers are required.

CWE-695.name: Use of Low-Level Functionality
CWE-695.description: The product uses low-level functionality that is explicitly prohibited by the framework or specification under which the product is supposed to operate.

CWE-698.name: Execution After Redirect (EAR)
CWE-698.description: The web application sends a redirect to another location, but instead of exiting, it executes additional code.

CWE-708.name: Incorrect Ownership Assignment
CWE-708.description: The product assigns an owner to a resource, but the owner is outside of the intended control sphere.

CWE-73.name: External Control of File Name or Path
CWE-73.description: The product allows user input to control or influence paths or file names that are used in filesystem operations.

CWE-733.name: Compiler Optimization Removal or Modification of Security-critical Code
CWE-733.description: The developer builds a security-critical protection mechanism into the software, but the compiler optimizes the program such that the mechanism is removed or modified.

CWE-749.name: Exposed Dangerous Method or Function
CWE-749.description: The product provides an Applications Programming Interface (API) or similar interface for interaction with external actors, but the interface includes a dangerous method or function that is not properly restricted.

CWE-756.name: Missing Custom Error Page
CWE-756.description: The product does not return custom error pages to the user, possibly exposing sensitive information.

CWE-76.name: Improper Neutralization of Equivalent Special Elements
CWE-76.description: The product correctly neutralizes certain special elements, but it improperly neutralizes equivalent special elements.

CWE-763.name: Release of Invalid Pointer or Reference
CWE-763.description: The product attempts to return a memory resource to the system, but it calls the wrong release function or calls the appropriate release function incorrectly.

CWE-764.name: Multiple Locks of a Critical Resource
CWE-764.description: The product locks a critical resource more times than intended, leading to an unexpected state in the system.

CWE-765.name: Multiple Unlocks of a Critical Resource
CWE-765.description: The product unlocks a critical resource more times than intended, leading to an unexpected state in the system.

CWE-766.name: Critical Data Element Declared Public
CWE-766.description: The product declares a critical variable, field, or member to be public when intended security policy requires it to be private.

CWE-767.name: Access to Critical Private Variable via Public Method
CWE-767.description: The product defines a public method that reads or modifies a private variable.

CWE-770.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
CWE-770.description: The product allocates a reusable resource or group of resources on behalf of an actor without imposing any intended restrictions on the size or number of resources that can be allocated.

CWE-771.name: Missing Reference to Active Allocated Resource
CWE-771.description: The product does not properly maintain a reference to a resource that has been allocated, which prevents the resource from being reclaimed.

CWE-772.name: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime
CWE-772.description: The product does not release a resource after its effective lifetime has ended, i.e., after the resource is no longer needed.

CWE-776.name: Improper Restriction of Recursive Entity References in DTDs ('XML Entity Expansion')
CWE-776.description: The product uses XML documents and allows their structure to be defined with a Document Type Definition (DTD), but it does not properly control the number of recursive definitions of entities.

CWE-778.name: Insufficient Logging
